#| label: futures-comparison
#| fig-cap: "Two Futures: Choose Wisely"

import sys
sys.path.insert(0, 'c:/code/decentralized-institutes-of-health')

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from brain.charts._chart_style import (
    setup_chart_style, add_watermark, clean_spines,
    COLOR_MID, COLOR_ACCENT, COLOR_DARK, COLOR_WHITE, COLOR_LIGHT, COLOR_BG
)

# Setup styling
setup_chart_style(style='light', dpi=150)

# Data
futures_data = pd.DataFrame({
    'Metric': ['Life\nExpectancy', 'Healthcare\nCost', 'AI\nAlignment', 'Economic\nGrowth', 'Disease\nBurden'],
    'Gollumland': [35, 100, 10, -40, 95],
    'Wishonia': [150, 5, 95, 400, 5]
})

x = np.arange(len(futures_data['Metric']))
width = 0.35

# Create chart
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(22, 10))
bars1 = ax.bar(x - width/2, futures_data['Gollumland'], width,
               label='Path A: Gollumland', color=COLOR_MID, edgecolor=COLOR_WHITE, linewidth=2)
bars2 = ax.bar(x + width/2, futures_data['Wishonia'], width,
               label='Path B: Wishonia', color=COLOR_ACCENT, edgecolor=COLOR_WHITE, linewidth=2)

ax.set_ylabel('Index (Relative Scale)', fontsize=36, weight='bold', color=COLOR_DARK)
ax.set_xticks(x)
ax.set_xticklabels(futures_data['Metric'], fontsize=36)
ax.tick_params(axis='y', labelsize=28, colors=COLOR_MID)
ax.tick_params(axis='x', colors=COLOR_DARK)
ax.legend(fontsize=40, loc='upper left')
ax.axhline(y=0, color=COLOR_MID, linestyle='-', linewidth=2, alpha=0.5)
clean_spines(ax)
ax.grid(axis='y', alpha=0.3, linestyle='--', color=COLOR_LIGHT)

# Add branding
add_watermark(fig)

# Don't use tight_layout - it overrides margins
plt.savefig('assets/charts/futures-comparison.png', dpi=150, bbox_inches=None, facecolor=COLOR_BG)
plt.show()
